#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Mentally Prepare for Surgery
#Text=Regardless of whether it a routine operation or a highly complex and life changing one , surgery can be a terrifying thing .
#Text=It is also something that can be emotionally challenging , and getting your head around the impending surgical process is an important part of being properly prepared .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Get some answers .
#Text=You may feel more confident about the surgery if you understand what is being done and why it is needed .

#Text=Once you understand this better , try to explain the procedure to friends and family ; talking about it and explaining what is going to happen to others can be a valuable way of boosting your confidence and helping you to feel more assured about what is going to be happening .
#Text=Make sure that your physical needs are going to be met .
#Text=Once you understand what the surgery entails and you are sure you ’re getting the surgery , you can start to prepare for the effects .
#Text=How will the surgery effect your life afterwards ?
#Text=How long will it take you to recover from the surgery ?
#Text=What can you and ca n’t you do before and after your surgery ?
#Text=For how long ?

#Text=These are the sorts of questions you should be sure that you have the answers to before you start anything else , as these will help you to properly prepare , and being prepared will make you feel more confident and comfortable with the surgery in general .
#Text=Pack for the visit .
#Text=Once you have the answers to your questions you can pack – think about how long you ’re going to be in the hospital and what sorts of things you ’re going to want .
#Text=You may want clean clothes , books , spectacles ( if you require them ) and so on .
#Text=Take anything you think you might miss or want to use during your stay , but try to limit it to just one bag .

#Text=If you need something else , your family and friends are often more than happy to take your dirty clothing and bring you clean , or exchange your books and games when you ’re finished with one .
#Text=If you ’re religious , you may choose to take an item that is significant to your religion ; if not , many people choose to take a family photo or album to encourage themselves .
#Text=Plan ahead .
#Text=If you‘re going to be out of work for a period of time post-surgery , take the appropriate steps to ensure that you and your family are provided for financially during this time .
#Text=This may be something you have to discuss with your health insurance or national health service ( it will vary depending on where you live ) .
#Text=Regardless of what you need to do in order to manage it , be sure that you ’re not going to end up in a tight spot financially as a result of your surgery .
#Text=Sorting this out in advance will prevent you from stressing about financial matters during your recovery .
#Text=Continue to communicate your concerns .

#Text=Regardless of whether it ’s asking your doctor questions or talking about your fears with your partner , be open about your feelings during this time , as keeping them to yourself could increase your stress .
#Text=The more relaxed you are , the better – some studies have shown that there are fewer complications in procedures where the patient feels confident and relaxed , particularly in women .
#Text=Thus , it is certainly worth trying to relax yourself and have confidence in your surgeon and the procedure as much as possible .
#Text=You might feel like keeping it to yourself when you ’re expecting surgery , but it can be much more beneficial to share the information with the people you care about and who care about you .
#Text=You may also find that there are people willing to help out with your household maintenance , meals , etc. , during your recovery but if they do n't know , they ca n't offer such help .
#Text=Have faith .
#Text=It does n’t have to be a deity or spirit that you choose to have faith in .
#Text=Have faith that your doctor will do everything that is needed to let you continue living a happy and healthy life , have faith that your body will heal .
#Text=Have faith that your family are waiting for you , encouraging you .

#Text=Have faith in yourself and everyone that loves you ; faith is a simple concept that gives you purpose during a time when you desperately need it , which can help to reduce your stress levels and thus make you more relaxed and confident .
#Text=Keep as fit as you can .
#Text=In the run up to your surgery , try to exercise as much as your condition safely allows , eat healthy , stay hydrated and get plenty of rest .

#Text=Being in tip-top condition during the surgery can improve your mood , which helps you to stay in a more positive frame of mind , as well as helping to reduce the risk of complications , so that you can be even more confident when going into the surgery .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Arrange with family members to be there for you when you come out of the actual surgery .
#Text=It can be reassuring to see familiar faces again after the event .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Items for the hospital visit in a suitable bag
#Text=Information about the surgery
#Text=Doctor 's phone numbers and contact details
#Text=Transportation to and from hospital
#Text=Phone numbers and contact details of family and friends
#Text=Medication , if needed
#Text=Recovery arrangements in place prior to surgery
